intro: Sisymbrium irio var. irioides, commonly known as the yellow rocket, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is an annual herb that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring basal leaves that are pinnately lobed. The plant produces yellow flowers in elongated clusters, which bloom from spring to early summer. Its seeds are small, dry, and contain a single embryo, typical of the Brassicaceae family. It is often found in disturbed soils and is known for its rapid growth and ability to colonize open areas.
